item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, November 19, 2024 at 8:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Show HN: Physically accurate black hole simulation using your iPhone camera (141 points | 56 comments)
2. Fair coins tend to land on the side they started: Evidence from 350,757 flips (244 points | 131 comments)
3. Hand Tracking for Mouse Input (67 points | 15 comments)
4. A subtle layout bug in Google Search: When CJK text-wrapping meets float (50 points | 17 comments)
5. Developing a D-20 Watch for Tabletop Roleplaying Games (26 points | 7 comments)
6. Show HN: Rust library for numerical integration of real-valued functions (86 points | 28 comments)
7. How to Build a Chess Engine and Fail (85 points | 17 comments)
8. The Analog Thing: Analog Computing for the Future (23 points | 10 comments)
9. Shift Left Is the Tip of the Iceberg (97 points | 40 comments)
10. Typesetting and printing a family memoir (2017) (7 points | 1 comment)
11. A joke in approximating numbers raised to irrational powers (50 points | 11 comments)
12. Justpaid.ai (YC W23) Is Hiring Software Engineers in Silicon Valley ( | hide)
13. Launch HN: Regatta Storage (YC F24) – Turn S3 into a local-like, POSIX cloud FS (521 points | 279 comments)
14. OpenStreetMap's New Vector Tiles (286 points | 107 comments)
15. Rim/Blackberry tales – reply all (128 points | 61 comments)
16. Scientific American's departing editor and the politicization of science (363 points | 635 comments)

18. Why I hate the index finger (1980) (105 points | 45 comments)

20. Maslow 4: Large format CNC routing made accessible (204 points | 68 comments)
21. Two undersea cables in Baltic Sea disrupted (485 points | 822 comments)
22. Ask HN: How do you communicate in a remote startup? (147 points | 186 comments)
23. 20 years of Google Scholar (383 points | 168 comments)
24. Austen and Darwin converged on the question of beauty (35 points | 5 comments)
25. Hyperfine: A command-line benchmarking tool (212 points | 50 comments)
26. Rumble CEO Chris Pavlovski Expresses Interest in Buying Google Chrome (6 points | discuss)
27. Uno Platform Studio Featuring Hot Design (43 points | 12 comments)
28. DOJ will push Google to sell off Chrome (1022 points | 1166 comments)
29. Gliimly is a programming language for web services (54 points | 61 comments)
30. MailCatcher runs a super simple SMTP server (278 points | 87 comments)
